subNodes.conversationText: root
The campsite is still burning, but Onko the Collector has moved on. Surprisingly, for such a large creature, it has left no tracks.
Leave the campfire.
The fat, grey creature looks up in delight as you approach. "<Race>, you return! And you bring a Xaviene!"
Continue
"What? What's going on?" Rani flutters around your head, suddenly agitated.
Continue

The creature turns to you. "Give me your Xaviene, and I will reward you with the thing of magic and metal. And I promise you that it will be humane.... quick, as one would kill a cow for its leather."
"This is evil, and I want no part in it."
"You tell him, <FullName>!" Rani is shaking with relief. "We're friends, you fat grey creep!"
Continue
"Very well," spits Onko. "Take your Xaviene and leave me, <Race>."
Leave the creature.
"You can have the faery. It hasn't been much use so far." [Grab Rani]
"Nooooo!" Rani cries out as you grab her. "You can't! <FullName>, you can't do this!"
Hand her to the creature.

Onko's little, beady red eyes bulge as he accepts the faery, quickly swaddling her in strips of cloth and vanishing her into a secret pocket. "Very good, <Race>! Very good. Now, your thing of metal and magic as promised."
Continue.

"A sword blessed to the holy Gods... earned through murder. Fitting, no?" 

The creature pulls out a long object wrapped in paper and hands it to you gently. You pull the paper aside and uncover a beautiful longsword, its blade slightly glowing with an inner fire.
Continue.
You turn back to speak to Onko again, but the grey creature has disappeared.
Time to leave.

"<Race>, I am a collector, of sorts. Onko the Collector, they call me. I collect things from the Raventhal, for people who are not prepared to come themselves. There are many, many precious things to be found here..... if you know where to look."
Continue

"At this point in time, I am collecting something of a.... delicate matter." His eyes flit to Rani, who is hovering near your head. "I am looking for Xaviene.... you know them as 'forest faeries'. I see you have one, and I would have it."
Continue
"No way!" Rani squeals in indignation. "There is no way <FullName> is giving me up to you, to be... eaten!"
Continue

"You mistake me, Xaviene. You taste nice, yes, but one bite and you're gone. There's no time to savour the flavour. But your skin, now, that is valuable - prized by the Mallovans, to make pouches for their herbs. Apparently nothing is quite as effective as a Faery-skin pouch."

The creature turns to you. "Give me your Xaviene, and I will reward you with a thing of magic and metal that you will prize highly. As for the Xaviene.... I promise you that it will be... humane, quick."
"This is evil, and I want no part of it."
"You tell him, <FullName>!" Rani flutters up into the air. "We're friends, you fat creep!"
Continue
"Very well," Onko snaps, turning away. "Take your Xaviene and leave me, <Race>."
Leave.
"You can have the faery. It hasn't been much use so far." [Grab Rani].
"Noooo!" Rani cries out as you grab her. "You can't! <FullName>, you can't do this!"
Hand her to the creature.

Onko's little, beady red eyes bulge as he accepts the faery, quickly swaddling her in strips of cloth and vanishing her into a secret pocket. 

"Very good, <Race>! Very good. Now, your thing of magic and metal as promised."
Continue.

"A sword blessed to the holy Gods... earned through murder. Fitting, no?"

The creature pulls out a long object wrapped in paper and hands it to you gently. You pull the paper aside and uncover a beautiful longsword, its blade slightly glowing.
Continue.
You turn back to speak to Onko again, but the creature has gone.
Leave.

The fat, grey creature remains at the campfire. It looks up at you as you approach, chins bulging.

"Have you brought me a faery, <Race>?"
"No."
"Come back then, when you have one."
Leave the creature.

"<Race>, I am a collector, of sorts. Onko the Collector, they call me. I collect things from the Raventhal, for people who are not prepared to come themselves. There are many, many precious things to be found here.... if you know where to look."
Continue.

"At this point in time, I am collecting something of a... a delicate matter. I am looking for Xaviene... you would know them as 'forest faeries'." The creature licks its lips with its fat, wet tongue. "If you can bring me a forest faery, I will reward you with a means of protecting yourself. A thing of magic and metal that you will prize very highly."
"What do you want a forest faery for?"

"Me? Nothing!" The creature's beady red eyes bore into you. "They taste... nice, yes, but one bite and they're gone. There's no time to savour their flavour. But their skins are highly prized by the Mallovans, who use them to make pouches for magic herbs. Apparently the Faery-skin pouches are simply excellent at keeping the herbs.... fresh."
"This is evil. I will have no part in it."

The fat, grey creature spits a string of thick black phlegm onto the floor.

"So be it, <Race>. Leave me, I have work to do. But if you find one, and change your mind, come and see me."
Leave the creature.
"I will see what I can do."
The fat, grey creature smiles up at you, showing its black, cracked and jagged teeth. "Good! Good. You bring me a faery, and I'll give you the thing of magic and metal. Good hunting, <Race>."
Leave the creature.
